title: Adding on-graph labels
text: Coloured labels placed directly plot better graph legends making final, polished version graph presentations, notes papers three key reasons. Labels make much easier reader identify group colour corresponds , without rapid eye twitch graph legend back . Repeat every group present graph soon recipe eyestrain. Labels make efficient use available space graph removing need make room legend. Legends create unused white space around legend element force plot shorter narrower otherwise . Finally, labels aesthetic legends.

title: Adding on-graph labels
text: simplest way add plot labels use plot_label() function theme61. following code provides example. code set mock data create graph, two lines important plot_label() lines. plot_label() requires provide text label (label), x y positioning. information, see documentation (?plot_label). using function, make sure wording vector label names label argument exactly colour/fill aesthetic plotted, order label vector matches order colour/fill aesthetic ordering colours. One way ensure setting column data ordered factor, calling label names using levels(data$col_name).
code: # Mock data graph_data <- CJ(   x = 2000:2020,   source = ordered(c("Source A", "Source B")) )  graph_data[source == "Source A", y := seq(0, by = 0.25, length = 21)] graph_data[source == "Source B", y := seq(0, by = 1, length = 21)]  # Graph graph <- ggplot(graph_data, aes(x, y, colour = source)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   plot_label(     label = levels(graph_data$source),     x = c(2016, 2016),     y = c(6, 13)   ) +   labs_e61(     title = "Plot Labels Using plot_label()",     sources = c("e61 Institute"),     x = NULL, y = "n"   )  save_e61("../man/figures/label-plot-label.svg", graph) knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/label-plot-label.svg")

title: Adding on-graph labels
text: facetted graph, must specify facet_name facet_value arguments plot_label().  want place labels different facets, simply supply vector facet_value facet want label appear .
code: data <- data.frame(   x = rep(c(1, 2), 2),   y = rep(c(1, 2), 2),   f_var = factor(c(1, 1, 2, 2)),   group = factor(c(1, 2, 1, 2)) )  p1 <-    ggplot(data, aes(x, y, colour = group)) +       facet_wrap(~f_var) +   geom_point() +   scale_y_continuous_e61(c(0, 3, 1)) +   plot_label(     label = c("Label 1", "Label 2"),     x = c(1, 1.85),     y = c(1.2, 2.2),     facet_name = "f_var",     facet_value = "1"   )   save_e61("../man/figures/label-facet-1.svg", p1) knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/label-facet-1.svg") p2 <- ggplot(data, aes(x, y, colour = group)) +   facet_wrap(~f_var) +   geom_point() +   scale_y_continuous_e61(c(0, 3, 1)) +   plot_label(     label = c("Label 1", "Label 2"),     x = c(1, 1.85),     y = c(1.2, 2.2),     facet_name = "f_var",     facet_value = c("1", "2")   )  save_e61("../man/figures/label-facet-2.svg", p2) knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/label-facet-2.svg")

title: Adding on-graph labels
text: Sometimes many categories, far many want plot manually even data.frame approach. willing sacrifice ability specify exact location label, use geom_text_repel() add appropriately coloured text labels colour/fill aesthetic.
code: # Mock data graph_data <- CJ(   year = 2000:2020,   source = paste("Source", LETTERS[1:5]) ) graph_data[, value := sample(5, nrow(graph_data), replace = TRUE)]  # Graph graph <- ggplot(graph_data, aes(x = year, y = value, fill = source)) +   geom_area(linewidth = 1) +                   # We only need one label for each group, ideally on the far                    # right of the graph, so we keep the last year only   geom_text_repel(data = graph_data[year == max(year)],                   aes(x = year, y = value, label = source, colour = source),                   # This forces the text to appear further right than 2020                   xlim = c(2020, NA),                   # This moves the vertical position of the label downwards                   position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5),                   # This hides the line that joins the label to the graph element                   segment.color = NA,                   size = 4) +   # Extends the right-side of the graph to create room for the labels   scale_x_continuous(limits = c(NA, 2026)) +   scale_colour_e61() +   labs_e61(     title = "Use geom_text_repel to Show Many Labels Automatically",     sources = c("e61 Institute"),     x = NULL, y = "n"   )  save_e61("../man/figures/label-cats.svg", graph) knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/label-cats.svg")

title: Introduction to theme61
text: theme61 e61 Institute’s graphing package producing graphs abide -house standards. works changing appearance functionality graphs produced using ggplot2 package. read article help understand create graphs following graph standards. article provides examples help figure elements can change. function documentation provides comprehensive information full customisability package.

title: Introduction to theme61
text: making graphs, follow workflow. Save graph using save_e61(). use Export button Plots tab ggsave(). Start creating graph using ‘normal’ stuff: ggplot(data, aes(x, y)) + geom_blah(). : Add plot labelling: plot_label() Add titles, axes labels, footnotes sources: labs_e61(title = "Title", subtitle = "Subtitle", footnotes = "Footnotes", sources = c("Source 1", "Source 2"), y = "%") (optional) Use theme_e61() want add legend, change position. aspects theme_e61() now added default. (optional) Format x y axes scales: scale_y_continuous_e61(), scale_x_continuous_e61(). y-axis automatically scaled save chart using save_e61() like automatic scaling can always scale axes manually. Save graph: save_e61().

title: Introduction to theme61
text: e61 Institute colour palette. colours package objects can selected using appropriate name. example, e61_tealdark3 selects colour ‘Teal dark’ shade column ‘3’.  also colour palette states/territories capital cities. usually used calling scale_fill_e61_aus scale_colour_e61_aus. , individual colours can also accessed named vector e61_aus_colours.

code: # Set up data mtcars2 <- within(mtcars, {   vs <- factor(vs, labels = c("V-shaped", "Straight"))   am <- factor(am, labels = c("Automatic", "Manual"))   cyl  <- factor(cyl)   gear <- factor(gear) })  # Graph g <- ggplot(mtcars2, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = gear)) +   geom_point() +   plot_label(     label = c("3 cyl", "4 cyl", "5 cyl"),     x = c(4, 2.7, 2.5),     y = c(23, 35, 15)   ) +   labs_e61(     title = "Car Fuel Efficiency and Weight",     subtitle = "Data from 1973-74",     sources = "1974 Motor Trend US magazine",     x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",     y = "mpg"   )  save_e61("../man/figures/g-scatter.svg")

title: Introduction to theme61
text: Note: Admittedly feature somewhat advanced/fiddly. Despite Hadley’s best efforts make difficult add differently-scaled second y-axis, feature now exists theme61. Implementing dual y-axis requires fair amount additional faff try step . First, structure data needs different usual best practice. Normally, want data long format, add separate groups using colour fill. However, want one lines secondary axis, series needs column. series also plotted separately geom_line() (geom_ depending want plot obviously), example . need transform y aesthetic series plotted secondary axis using sec_rescale_inv() function (see documentation required arguments). also need manually specify colour colour lines, using palette_e61(). must specify sec_axis argument scale_y_continuous_e61() sec_axis(~sec_rescale(.), name = "name"). Replace “name” y-axis label. must specified otherwise show blank. also need set rescale_sec = TRUE ensure formatting appropriately adjusted secondary axis. Finally, need run code twice, first time, error caused R internally assigns objects generated simultaneous function calls (may get fixed future).
code: g <- ggplot(data_dual, aes(x = year)) +    geom_line(aes(y = `Food and Tobacco`), colour = palette_e61(2)[[1]]) +   # All the action is in the next 5 lines   geom_line(aes(y = sec_rescale_inv(`Personal Care`, scale = 0.1, shift = 0)),              colour = palette_e61(2)[[2]]) +   scale_y_continuous_e61(limits = c(0, 100, 25), name = "$b",                          # Usually you don't need to supply scale and shift again but to get the vignette to run you do here                          sec_axis = sec_axis(~sec_rescale(., scale = 0.1, shift = 0), name = "$b"),                           rescale_sec = TRUE) +   plot_label(c("Food and Tobacco\n(LHS)", "Personal Care\n(RHS)"),               c(1945, 1948),               c(75, 40)) +   labs_e61(     title = "US Personal Expenditures*",     subtitle = "1940-1960",     footnotes = "Data comes from the built-in USPersonalExpenditure dataset.",     sources = c("e61 Institute", "'datasets' package"),     y = "$b"   )

title: Introduction to theme61
text: geom_pointrange() useful plotting regression coefficients. plotting coefficients time, e.g. event study, including geom_line() can also help show passage time.
code: g <- ggplot(pt_rg_data, aes(x, y, ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax)) +    geom_vline(xintercept = 0, linetype = 2, linewidth = 0.25) +   add_baseline() +   geom_pointrange(colour = e61_tealdark) +   geom_line(colour = e61_tealdark) +   labs_e61(     title = "Regression Coefficients",     sources = c("e61 Institute"),     y = "%"   ) save_e61("../man/figures/g-ptrg.svg")

title: Introduction to theme61
text: discovered research notes putting multiple graphs together grid/panel works quite well format. Note graph titles need done differently multi-panels. Individual panels sources footnotes, footer full multi-panel instead. First make sub-plots graph. use save_e61() put graphs together.
code:
g1 <-   ggplot(data_3, aes(x = year, y = value, colour = category)) +   geom_line() +   plot_label(c("Food and
Tobacco", "Household
Operation", "Medical and
Health"),               c(1944, 1954, 1953),               c(65, 55, 25)) +   labs_e61(     title = "Aggregates",     y = "$b"   )  g2 <- ggplot(data_dual, aes(x = year)) +     geom_line(aes(y = `Food and Tobacco`), colour = palette_e61(2)[[1]]) +     geom_line(aes(y = `Personal Care`), colour = palette_e61(2)[[2]]) +     scale_y_continuous_e61(limits = c(0, 100, 25)) +   plot_label(     c("Food and Tobacco
(LHS)", "Personal Care
(RHS)"),     c(1945, 1952),     c(75, 15)   ) +   labs_e61(     title = "Selected Aggregates",     y = "$b"   )  g3 <-   ggplot(data_col, aes(x = category, y = value, fill = factor(year))) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   plot_label(c("1940", "1960"),               c(1.55, 2.05),               c(15, 50)) +   labs_e61(     title = "1940 to 1960 Change",      y = "$b"   )  g4 <-    ggplot(data_chg[category == "Food and Tobacco"], aes(x = year)) +   geom_line(aes(y = value), colour = palette_e61(2)[[1]]) +   geom_col(aes(y = change), fill = palette_e61(2)[[2]]) +   scale_y_continuous_e61(limits = c(0, 100, 20)) +   plot_label(     c("Aggregate", "Change from
5 years ago"),     c(1941, 1952),     c(55, 25)   ) +   labs_e61(     title = "Food and Tobacco Spending",      y = "$b"   ) save_e61(     g1, g2, g3, g4,     filename = "../man/figures/g-multi.svg",     title = "US Personal Expenditures*",     footnotes = "Data comes from the built-in USPersonalExpenditure dataset.",     sources = c("e61 Institute", "'datasets' package") )

Dual y-axis graphing functions — sec_rescale_inv
text: ggplot2, design, makes rather difficult create graphs primary secondary y-axis different scales. Hadley Wickham claims prevent people abusing secondary y-axis show dodgy correlations (investment banking-style). However, sometimes valid uses following functions enable little fiddliness possible.

title: Dual y-axis graphing functions — sec_rescale_inv
code: sec_rescale_inv(values, scale = 1, shift = 0)  sec_rescale(   values,   scale = t61_env$sec_axis_scale,   shift = t61_env$sec_axis_shift )

title: Dual y-axis graphing functions — sec_rescale_inv
text: values Vector data normally passed y aesthetic graph. scale Numeric. Multiplicative factor rescales axis. example, scale originally 0 50, scale = 0.1 rescale 0 5. shift Numeric. Moves axis . example, scale 0 5, shift = 5 moves secondary scale 5 units range -5 0.

title: Dual y-axis graphing functions — sec_rescale_inv
text: sec_rescale_inv used geom displayed secondary axis. sec_rescale used sec_axis argument scale_y_continuous_e61. See examples use two functions manipulate secondary axis. Trial error needed select appropriate scale shift values. Note: Due way ggplot functions interact R environment, run code generates graph twice change changes show .

title: Dual y-axis graphing functions — sec_rescale_inv
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2) data <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y1 = 1:5 * 10, y2 = 5:1 - 5)  ggplot(data, aes(x)) +   geom_col(aes(y = y1)) +   geom_point(aes(y = sec_rescale_inv(y2, scale = 0.1, shift = 5))) +   # Some extra arguments are required to correctly format the secondary axis:   # Set rescaled_sec = TRUE in scale_y_continuous_e61() to format the breaks correctly.   # The secondary y-axis label (name = "%") needs to be explicitly specified otherwise it will not appear.   scale_y_continuous_e61(limits = c(0, 60, 10), sec_axis = sec_axis(~sec_rescale(.), name = "%"), rescale_sec = TRUE) +   labs_e61(y = "%") } # }

title: Format axes in the e61 style — scale_y_continuous_e61
code: scale_y_continuous_e61(   limits = NULL,   sec_axis = ggplot2::dup_axis(),   rescale_sec = FALSE,   y_top = TRUE,   expand_bottom = 0,   expand_top = 0,   ... )  scale_x_continuous_e61(   limits = NULL,   expand_left = 0.05,   expand_right = 0.05,   hide_first_last = FALSE,   ... )

title: Format axes in the e61 style — scale_y_continuous_e61
text: limits One : numeric vector length three providing limits scale increment axis tick, e.g. c(0, 25, 5) set axis range 0 25, increments 5 per tick. numeric vector length two providing minimum maximum limits scale. break increments automatically chosen. NULL use default scale range. sec_axis Logical. Defaults duplicating y-axis shows left right. Set FALSE hide secondary axis. rescale_sec Logical. Set TRUE using rescaled secondary axis, otherwise leave FALSE (default). add rescaled secondary axis, see documentation sec_rescale. y_top Logical. Ensures space top y-axis axis label. Defaults TRUE. Set FALSE axis label placed elsewhere. change argument also need change argument name theme_e61. expand_bottom, expand_top Numeric. Add extra space data points top/bottom graph. See expansion details. ... Arguments passed ggplot2::scale_y_continuous name name scale. Used axis legend title. waiver(), default, name scale taken first mapping used aesthetic. NULL, legend title omitted. oob One : Function handles limits outside scale limits (bounds). Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. default (scales::censor()) replaces bounds values NA. scales::squish() squishing bounds values range. scales::squish_infinite() squishing infinite values range. na.value Missing values replaced value. trans Deprecated favour transform. guide function used create guide name. See guides() information. expand_left, expand_right Numeric. Add extra space data points left/right graph. See expansion details. hide_first_last Logical. Defaults FALSE. Hides first last x-axis labels avoid overlapping bottom y-axis.

text: filename File name create disk. Providing file format extension (e.g. .svg) suggested saving single file format. file extension must lowercase. want save multiple formats, include extension, see format argument details. ... (multi-panel specific) Plot objects put panel. plot (single-panel specific) Name plot object save. Defaults last plot displayed usually need provide argument explicitly. format string vector file formats save . Accepts "svg", "pdf", "eps", "png", "jpg". example c("svg", "pdf") save 2 files name location SVG PDF formats. file format specified filename set_format option, argument ignored. chart_type String, vector strings saving multiple plots. Type chart. used set sensible chart widths based type plot saving. Options "normal" (default; normal charts), "wide" (time series graphs) "square" (scatter plots). auto_scale Logical. Scale y-axis automatically. Default TRUE. dim named list specifying plot height width. Defaults NULL means graph dimensions calculated automatically. pad_width Numeric. Add horizontal whitespace sides graph. Defaults additional padding. max_height Numeric. maximum height plot cm. used constrain plot resizing algorithm cases want limit height charts. Defaults NULL restrict height. preview Logical. Set TRUE show preview graph Viewer pane save disk. Defaults FALSE. save_data Logical. Set TRUE want save .csv name graph contains data needed recreate graph (defaults FALSE). print_info Logical. Set TRUE want graph dimensions information printed console. Defaults FALSE. base_size Numeric. Chart font size. Default 10. res Numeric. saving PNG . Rescale size saved PNG. E.g. res = 2 doubles size saved graph. bg_colour Set graph background colour. Accepts colour name, hex code theme61 colour object name. Defaults "white". graphs used research note boxes, set colour e61_boxback. plotlist (multi-panel specific) List plots combine multi-panel save. can also enter charts individually arguments function. title text title. subtitle text subtitle. footnotes vector footnote text strings. new string prepended *, **, ***, etc. Note need include asterisks title/subtitle . Please sensible number separate points include graph. sources String vector providing names sources graph. spacing_adj (multi-panel specific) named list specifying adjustment title subtitle. Rescales size space given multi-panel title/subtitle. Use think title looks cramped chart. height_adj (multi-panel specific) Rescales height multi-panel. function sets sensible defaults provides manual control need . ncol (optional) Number columns plot grid. nrow (optional) Number rows plot grid. align (optional) Specifies whether graphs grid horizontally ("h") vertically ("v") aligned. Options "none" (default), "hv" (align directions), "h", "v". axis (optional) Specifies whether graphs aligned left ("l"), right ("r"), top ("t"), bottom ("b") margins. Options "none" (default), string combination l, r, t, b order (e.g. "tblr" "rlbt" aligning margins). Must specified graphs complex (e.g. faceted) alignment specified desired. title: theme61 0.6.4
theme61 0.6.4
text: New function set_format sets default file format graphs get saved session. New custom geom geom_pointbar combines geom_point geom_errorbar one. New colours states territories/capital cities, accessible via scale_colour_e61_aus/scale_fill_e61_aus directly named vector e61_aus_colours.

title: theme61 0.6.4
text: Fixed issue ridgeline plots (plots discrete y-axis) saved save_e61. Fixed issue save_e61 dropped map legends. Fixed issue footnote wrapping pad_width used. Minor documentation fixes. Minor backend adjustments colour palette functions.

title: theme61 0.6.3
theme61 0.6.3
text: Add preview mode save_e61 save file allows graph viewed Viewer pane. chart_type argument save_e61 updated now allows adjust aspect ratio chart easy consistent way. three valid values normal (aspect ratio 0.75), wide (aspect ratio 0.5) square (aspect ratio 1). can also supply list values save_e61 saving multiple charts. Added ability save JPEGs. functions similar way PNGs currently saved - can use res argument save_e61 adjust resolution.

title: theme61 0.6.3
text: Fixed issue y-axis labels aligned correctly saving multiple plots time. Fixed issue use * footnotes (e.g. describing level statistical significance) without save_e61 interpreting new footnote. Fixed legend positioning argument broke due ggplot2 3.5.0 release. Fixed issue y-axis labels --position certain graphs. Replaced uninformative error message y-axis limits include full range data informative error message. Fixed image rendering issues website (think).

title: theme61 0.6.2
theme61 0.6.2
text: theme61 now requires R version least 4.3.0. Improvements plot_label: now supports facetted graphs! well back-end changes. now new shades e61 Blue Dark #10485E, Blue Light #196F91, Orange Dark #ED7F00 Orange Light #FFC537. changes aim improve contrast colours used graph. Added argument save_e61 fix issue y_top = FALSE positioning y-axis label correctly. Change default colour single line graphs black e61 Teal Dark. Changed ordering colours appear default e61 palette.

title: theme61 0.6.2
text: Fix weird edge case y-axis breaks relating oddities floating point maths. theme61 blow uninformatively tried supply graph data containing NA NaN. Now catches . Removed dplyr dependency.

title: theme61 0.6.1
text: 09 Nov 2023 Graphs automatically appear Viewer pane save save_e61(). users base maps, now new function setup_stadia_maps() help register API key Stadia Maps. Fixed changes base maps meant e61_map() longer worked renamed function add_map_e61(). .factor longer breaks variable detection scale_colour_e61(). Fixed various issues y-axis labels scales. Workaround 401 Authentication error loading package.

title: theme61 0.6.0

what: Automatic graph sizing, and y-axis, colour and fill scaling
title: theme61 0.6.0
text: major breaking change. code simpler may need changes work. improvements applied save graphs using save_e61(), show preview. Graphs now automatically size correctly. longer need figure appropriate graph height. Titles, subtitles footnotes automatically scale fit panel width. Y-axis automatically set limits breaks aesthetic defaults. can override providing limits using scale_y_continuous_e61(). Colour/fill automatically apply e61 Institute colour palette. works define fill/colour variable main ggplot call (e.g. ggplot(data, aes(x, y, fill = fill))). longer need specify number colours using scale_colour/fill_e61(). Added different default graph dimensions micro notes, research notes PowerPoint presentations. features implemented directly theme61::ggplot(). masks ggplot() function ggplot2 wish call original function need specify namespace like ggplot2::ggplot(). Make sure load theme61 ggplot2 otherwise correct functions called.

title: theme61 0.6.0
text: functionality mplot_label() combined plot_label(). mplot_label() now deprecated users need rename instances mplot_label() plot_label(). mpanel_e61() retired functionality incorporated directly save_e61(). Added console messages help correct common graphing mistakes. Changed default font graphs ‘PT Sans’ consistent research note font. Allow rotation labels plot_label(). Renamed add_zeroline() add_baseline(), e61_palette() palette_e61().

title: theme61 0.6.0
text: Fixed issue saving graphs title created whitespace plot. Documentation vignettes rewritten reflect new workflow.

title: theme61 0.5.0

title: theme61 0.5.0
text: Add ability save graphs multiple formats using new format argument save_e61(). Add support save_e61() saving images PDF format compatibility LaTeX. Change default alignment plot labels left-align added new argument hjust plot_label()/mplot_label() change alignment. Added ability add white box around text plot_label()/mplot_label() geom argument. Added y argument add_zeroline() can put zero line values zero. Added argument scale_x_continuous_e61() add back first/last labels removed default. Slightly increased default size plot labels match size axis text. save_e61() now notifies forget use theme scale functions.

title: theme61 0.5.0
text: Permanent fix bug temporarily bodged v0.4.1. Now dates can entered strings plot_label() converted dates. Fixed bug scale_y_continuous_e61() made y_top stop working also refactored code. Fixed bug mplot_label() didn’t allow vector colours supplied.

title: theme61 0.5.0
text: Added new Graph standards vignette based masterclass materials. Added documentation explaining rel_heights mpanel_e61() works. Miscellaneous minor documentation improvements.

title: theme61 0.4.1
text: 08 May 2023 Fixing bug plot_label() caused change dates work R 4.3.0. Unfortunately means using dates specify x-axis locations label, now surround .Date() rather just putting plain string.

title: theme61 0.4.0
text: 21 Apr 2023 Add ability make multi-panel graphs via mpanel_e61() (referring combining multiple discrete graphs single panel, faceted graphs). Add dual y-axis support allowing graphs secondary y-axes different scales created. Add experimental automatic graph height calculation save_e61(), reduce need users manually specify height saving graphs. Add argument save_e61() allow save data used produce graph csv. Correct whitespace margins around graphs. Improvements various documentation.

title: theme61 0.3.1
text: 15 Mar 2023 Refactored mplot_label() use plot_label() underlying function rather data.frame geom_text(). fixed two bugs function throws error colour aesthetic ggplot() aes x argument automatically converting dates. Changed colour palette third colour now dark blue rather grey.

title: theme61 0.3.0
text: 09 Mar 2023 Add new function format_flip_bar_charts() applies formatting needed make horizontal bar graphs pretty. Add new functions plot_label() mplot_label() make easier add -graph plot labels. mplot_label() vectorised version lets multiple labels one function. Add new function add_zeroline() add appropriately formatted black line along zero y-axis. New functionality scale_y_continuous_e61() specify break intervals directly limits argument. New vignette explaining use -graph labelling legends. Add new messages information save_e61() try explain users need set dimensions get good graph aesthetics. Add argument turn text wrapping labs_e61(). Add argument change aspect ratio theme_e61(). Change default dimension behaviour save_e61() make graphs look sensible 8.5 cm widths (corresponds half width Word document). Change base_size graph text font size readable 8.5 cm widths. Remove y_title_top_e61() incorporate functionality directly theme_e61() default. Users can choose disable behaviour y_top = FALSE argument. Update Getting Started vignette showcase new functionality. Fix issue labels argument scale_colour/fill_e61() working. minor improvements functions, messages documentation.

title: theme61 0.2.1
text: 20 Dec 2022 Minor adjustments title/footnote font size default max character width account new fixed aspect ratio.

title: theme61 0.2.0
text: 14 Dec 2022 Adds base map function e61_map() sensible defaults mapping. Improvements automatic discrete colour palette selection. Changes theme fix graphs 0.75 aspect ratio. Added alternate minimal theme called theme_e61_clean(). New add-creates charts based esquisse. Updated save_e61() allow save plots recently generated one. Many functions renamed closely align existing ggplot2 function names, _e61 appended , example e61_colour_manual now becomes scale_colour_e61. old functions now deprecated made defunct future versions. Please stop using use new functions instead.

title: theme61 0.1.0
text: 13 May 2022 first functional release theme61 containing everything need make graph e61 style. includes ggplot functions customise theme, axes graph elements. Implements e61 Institute colour palette scale_colour/fill_* function provides colour names data files manual access required. Save functions ensure default graphs appropriate sizing dimensions.
